explains: adj. 不协调的；不一致的；不和谐的

sentences.en: She was small and fragile and looked incongruous in an army uniform.
sentences.cn: 她人瘦小，穿上军装显得很不协调。

sentences.en: If participation and the culture are incongruous, employees are likely to perceive the participation process as manipulative and be negatively affected by it.
sentences.cn: "如果这种参与活动和组织文化不协调，那么员工可能会觉得他们的参与过程受到人为控制，也会因此受到负面影响。

sentences.en: Such traditional methods seem incongruous in our technical age.
sentences.cn: 此类传统方法似乎同我们今天的科技时代格格不入。
